intro: Angelophyllum ursinum, commonly known as the bear's garlic, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant produces small white to greenish flowers that are often clustered together, giving it a delicate appearance. It is typically found in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun. Angelophyllum ursinum is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
